title: Grandview woman, 43, charged in granddaughter's shooting
content:
KANSAS CITY, MO (KCTV) -
A 43-year-old Grandview woman has been charged in connection with the shooting of her 4-year-old granddaughter.
Taprill R. Barnett has been charged with one felony count of endangering the welfare of a child.
According to court records, Barnett’s daughter brought the victim to visit her grandmother. Barnett told police she was cleaning her gun and slid the gun under the couch when the victim and another child came into the room.
Barnett said she thought that would prevent the victim from getting the gun. She then left the room and heard a "pop." Upon returning, Barnett found the victim shot in the leg.
"We are fortunate that another child was not killed due to the irresponsibility of an adult. As gun-owners, we have the simple responsibility to ensure that these deadly-weapons are safely stored." Jackson County Prosecutor Jean Peters Baker said. "This isn’t hard, but it is absolutely life and death."
Prosecutors have requested a bond of $30,000 and have asked for a special condition of any bond to include that the victim shall have no unsupervised contact with children under the age of 17.
